moves.1. d4: This is one of the game I won by luck... d4
moves.5... Nf6 6. a3 Bxc3+ 7. Qxc3 O-O 8. Nf3: Both side developing their pieces since queen's gambit is a slow tempo game.
moves.8... Re8 9. Qc2 h6 10. Be2 dxc4 11. Bxc4: This move is a dangerous one, when I push the pawn it leaves my knight unprotected but my next move will be fianchettoing the bishop.
moves.13. Be2 Bb7 14. b3 Qd6 15. Bb2 Ne7 16. R: My goal is try to put pressure on the knight, pinning the knight.
moves.18. Bd3 g5: Trying something dangerous here, breaking up my king's safety
moves.19. e4: white tries to defend the center pushing pawn to e4
moves.19... Qd7 20. Ne5: a strong outpost for the knight
moves.20... Qd8 21. Re3 Kg7 22. Rg3 Nh5: Defending my king my scaring the rook away and removing my pin pawn at g5
moves.23. Rf3 Rf8 24. d5 f6 25. Ng4 exd5 26. N: This is a dangerous move white made, a knight sacrifice
moves.26... Nxf6 27. e5: white pushes pawn, looking for a discover check with bishop
moves.27... Ne4: Since theres no threat from the double check tried to move my knight to trade off bishops.
moves.28. Rxf8 Qxf8 29. f3 Qf4: I didn't know that I just trapped my knight!
moves.31... Kh7 32. Qc3: Now I have to be worried about my position of the king queen to c3 forcing checkmate
moves.33. Qf6: queen to f6....forcing possibly mate with queen to f7 next move
moves.33... Rg8: Now i have to sacrifice my rook I know.
moves.34. Rxc7+: This is a blunder move by white, white takes pawn at c7 not knowing its guarded by my queen.
moves.34... Qxc7 35. Qxf5+ Rg6 36. Qf8: White still has that strong pass pawn, now forcing mate at h8
moves.37... Qc5+: However the life saving move was queen to c5 check......
moves.38. Kf1: This stops the promotion of the pawn, rook takes queen at f8.
